details.title: Fanfare
details.content: The jam packed Kalinga stadium cheers for the 'Men in Blue' as they warm up before the start of their first encounter against South Africa.

details.title: National Anthem
details.content: Both the teams walk into the stadium for the National Anthem.

Every voice counts! These South African fans have made a long journey to the Odisha Hockey Men's World Cup Bhubaneswar 2018, but their team is sure to appreciate the boost that their support will provide.#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA pic.twitter.com/0kgDdIGFGp

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: Result of the first match of the tournament
details.content:
Odisha Hockey Men's World Cup Bhubaneswar 2018 opener was a spectacle as Belgium edged past Canada, 2-1 in a fairly contested match.#BELvCAN #IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey pic.twitter.com/cTyhd8xDcc

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: Match starts
details.content: The game gets underway with India having the early possession.

details.title: The Indian line-up
details.content:
Here’s the Starting XI of the Indian Men’s Hockey Team who will begin their campaign at the Odisha Hockey Men’s World Cup Bhubaneswar 2018 against South Africa on 28th November 2018.#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey pic.twitter.com/ylYCOpoISP

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: Match preview by The New Indian Express
In South African circles
details.content: Indian forwards are creating the pressure by pushing into the South African goal.
CHANCE! Team India seems lively from the start as Manpreet crafts an opportunity for a waiting Mandeep Singh in the circle, but the ball has too much power on it for an effective trap.

details.title: Sachin Tendulkar wishes Team India
details.content:
Best wishes to Team India for the #HWC2018 commencing in Bhubaneswar, Odisha today. I believe in you, the nation believes in you. Go get ‘em. Chak de, India! #HumBhiHockey pic.twitter.com/3tX8HVWhEg

— Sachin Tendulkar (@sachin_rt) November 28, 2018

details.title: Penalty Corner
details.content: India wins a penalty corner

details.title: First goal
details.content: India score the first goal from the penalty corner.
9' GOAL! Mandeep Singh gets India off to a great start as he slams in the rebound from Harmanpreet set-piece flick.

details.title: Goal Scorer
Second Goal!
details.content: India are 2-0 with three minutes left in the first quarter.

12' GOAL! @akashdeeps985 makes it two in favour of India as he uses his poacher's instinct to get to the ball first in a crowded circle and finishes with class.

IND 2-0 RSA#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA pic.twitter.com/n4i30PfVnu

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: End of first quarter
details.content: India lead 2-0 at the end of first 15 minutes play with goals from Mandeep and Akashdeep.

details.title: Stats
details.content:
Circle Pentrations:

India-11, South Africa-2

Possession: 

India-67%, South Africa-33%

details.title: Second quarter underway
details.content: Play resumes with India pressing for more goals.

details.title: Penalty corner for India
details.content: India wins another penalty corner but are unable to convert this time around.

details.title: South Africa attacks
details.content: South Africa is trying to get back in the game with some possession and pressing in the Indian half.

20' Simranjeet is proving his effectiveness as his agility allows him to play an essential part in the forwards' build-up play.

IND 2-0 RSA#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018
South Africa is trying hard to penetrate into the Indian circle.

details.title: Half-time
details.content: India lead 2-0 against South Africa after the end of 30 minutes play.

details.title: Stats
details.content:
Circle penetrations:

India-18, South Africa- 6

Possession: 

India- 64%, South Africa-34%

details.title: Dhanraj Pillay cheers from the stands
details.content:
When the architect of modern hockey Dhanraj Pillay comes out himself to cheer the men in blue in their opening campaign of the Odisha Hockey Men's World Cup Bhubaneswar 2018 against South Africa on 28th November.#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey pic.twitter.com/dQ2cHcTPnB

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: Second half begins
details.content: India take the early advantage by pressing into the South African circle in the second half.

details.title: Third PC for India
details.content: India win a penalty corner in the third quarter. The ball goes wide after hitting the post.
via GIPHY
Both the teams are pressing to find the goal but the strikers lack the finishing touch.

details.title: What if?
details.content: If India find the back of the net one more time, it will be difficult for South Africa to get back in the game.

Hockey fans loving being at the Odisha #HWC2018 Bhubaneswar!
@TheHockeyIndia
📸 FIH/ @GettyImages pic.twitter.com/LkS2C898Uf

— International Hockey Federation (@FIH_Hockey) November 28, 2018

37' The ball is passed around the midfield by Team India as they try their best to avoid turning over the ball to a South African team bursting with newfound aggression.

IND 2-0 RSA#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: French fans enjoying the WC
details.content:
A french family revels in the magic of the Odisha Hockey Men's World Cup Bhubaneswar 2018. They're here for the entire tournament and are backing India after France to win the tournament. #IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey pic.twitter.com/Q30f7LQpzH

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018
Team India's forwards have their task cut out for them as the South African defense play like they have no intention of conceding a third.

details.title: Third goal
details.content: India score the third goal with brilliant field play and finishing.

43' GOAL! @mandeepsingh995's quick run and cross into the circle are perfectly timed for Simranjeet to finish. India lead by 3!

IND 3-0 RSA#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA pic.twitter.com/sVFlcZYJqa

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: Fourth goal!
details.content: India now take an almost unassailable lead of 4-0.

details.title: Stats at the end of third quarter
details.content:
Circle penetrations:

India- 26, South Africa- 14

Possession:

India- 60%, South Africa- 40%

details.title: PC for India
details.content: India win a penalty corner early in the fourth quarter. Simranjeet converts it into a goal.

45' GOAL! @akashdeeps985's awareness comes into play as he delivers a deep ball into the circle with just power on it speed for @lalithockey to deflect into the goal.

IND 4-0 RSA#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA pic.twitter.com/uvIXurB7yQ

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: Fifth goal!
details.content:
46' GOAL! Simranjeet strikes again as he feeds off the rebound to finish past the South African GK.

IND 5-0 RSA#IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey #INDvRSA pic.twitter.com/mMRGf0eNN7

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018
A powerful shot from Harmanpreet is blocked on the line!
Mandeep Singh brings on the entertainment with a mazy run through the South African circle.

Raja Namdhari, from One Team One Dream hails the Bhubaneswar crowd and expresses his desire of India winning the OHMWC Bhubaneswar 2018. He has brought in a fan force from all corners of India to back the Indian team. #INDvRSA #BELvCAN #IndiaKaGame #HWC2018 #DilHockey pic.twitter.com/t8ic2321SA

— Hockey India (@TheHockeyIndia) November 28, 2018

details.title: PC for South Africa
details.content: South Africa win a penalty corner with just 30 seconds of play remaining.

details.title: India refer
details.content: India refer against the PC decision and win it. No penalty corner.

details.title: India win!
details.content: India start their 2018 Men's Hockey World Cup campaign with a 5-0 win against South Africa

details.title: Man of the match
details.content: Simranjeet Singh wins the Man of the Match for his superb performance.
